newsitem.title: USA: Harmony, Cypress Chem merger talks end.
newsitem.headline: Harmony, Cypress Chem merger talks end.

text.p: Harmony Products Inc said on Tuesday negotiations with privately held Cypress Chemical Co over its plan to acquire Harmony had been terminated and a non-binding letter of intent had expired.

The companies said on August 23 synthetic fertilizer maker Cypress signed a non-binding letter of intent to acquire an 85 percent controlling interest in the specialty fertilizer company via a stock swap.
Cypress and Harmony concluded they would be unable to complete the transaction on terms consistent with the letter of intent, Harmony said.
Cypress wanted to continue to be a contract production point for certain Harmony products in 1997, Harmony said.
